node.body:
_⚠️ Potential issue_ | _🟠 Major_

**Fix test isolation to enable parallel execution.**

Eight tests (44% of the integration test suite) are marked `#[ignore]` due to branch name conflicts during parallel execution. This significantly reduces test coverage and could mask regressions.

Tests should be properly isolated to run in parallel. Consider:
- Using unique branch names per test (e.g., include test name + timestamp/UUID)
- Implementing proper test cleanup in teardown
- Using test fixtures that guarantee unique resource names



Example approach for unique branch names:

```rust
#[tokio::test]
async fn test_create_worktree_basic() -> Result<()> {
    let test_id = uuid::Uuid::new_v4();
    let branch_name = format!("test-branch-{}", test_id);
    
    let (_temp_dir, repo_path) = create_temp_git_repo()?;
    let manager = GitWorktreeManager::new(repo_path)?;
    
    let worktree_path = manager.create_worktree(&branch_name, None, None).await?;
    // ... rest of test
}
```


Also applies to: 115-115, 168-168, 187-187, 214-214, 247-247, 331-331, 389-389

<details>
<summary>🤖 Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In tests/integration_tests.rs around lines 84, 115, 168, 187, 214, 247, 331 and
389, several integration tests are ignored due to branch name conflicts when
running tests in parallel; fix each test to generate and use unique branch names
(e.g., append a UUID or timestamp derived test id), ensure each test creates its
own temporary repo/worktree fixture and performs proper teardown/cleanup, and
update test signatures to return Result where needed so setup/teardown errors
propagate; this will allow the tests to run in parallel safely without shared
branch name collisions.
```

</details>
